info.title: SpiceRx API Endpoint Playground
info.description: Phytochemical-disease associations, spice-disease relationships, and chemical property data for spices and medicinal plants

tags.name: Spice-Disease Associations
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving spice-disease relationship data

tags.name: Chemical-Disease Associations
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving chemical-disease relationship data

get.description: This endpoint returns all positive and negative associations of diseases linked with a spice and the phytochemicals linked with each disease. It also contains phytochemicals directly linked with the spice. Response fields include: display_name (name of spice), disease_id (Disease ID linked with the spice), associations_positive (Positive associations linked with a disease ID), associations_negative (Negative associations linked with a disease ID), linked_phytochemicals (Phytochemicals linked with a disease ID), phytochemicals (Phytochemicals associated with the spice).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The taxonomy ID of the spice

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

get.summary: Get chemical details by MeSH ID
get.description: This endpoint returns detailed chemical information based on the chemical MeSH ID. Response includes: Chemical ID (MeSH ID), PubChem CID, Canonical SMILES, Isomeric SMILES, Common name, IUPAC name, InChI (Digital signature), Num_Atoms, Molecular_Formula, Molecular_Weight, Molecular_Mass, ALogP (Lipophilicity), Molecular_Solubility (mol/L), pKa, Num_AromaticBonds, Num_AromaticRings, HBA_Count, HBD_Count, Num_H_Acceptors, Num_H_Donors, Num_Rings, Num_RotatableBonds, Molecular_SurfaceArea, ADMET properties (Solubility, BBB Level, Hepatotoxicity, Absorption, Plasma Protein Binding), and fingerprint data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The MeSH ID of the chemical. The MeSH ID (Medical Subject Headings) is a unique identifier for chemicals in biomedical databases.

get.summary: Get all spices and phytochemicals associated with a disease
get.description: This endpoint returns all spices that have associations with a given disease and all phytochemicals directly linked with the disease. Response includes: plant (spice metadata like common name, TAX ID), associations_positive (positive associations between disease and spice), associations_negative (negative associations), linked_phytochemicals (linking phytochemicals in the association), phytochemicals (phytochemicals directly linked with the disease), and disease details (Disease ID, Title, Category, Sub-category, TreeNums).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The MeSH ID of the disease

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

get.description: Search for diseases based on different parameters like category, sub-category, title, and MeSH ID. Response contains: disease (Disease ID, Disease Title, Disease Category, Disease Sub-category, TreeNums - hierarchical classification code indicating where the disease sits in medical taxonomy), and num_associations (number of associations with the disease).

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The name of the disease

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category the disease belongs to

parameters.name: sub_category
parameters.description: The sub-category the disease belongs to

parameters.name: mesh_id
parameters.description: The MeSH ID of the disease

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

get.description: This endpoint returns all details about relationships between a disease and phytochemical and their associations. Response includes: associations (journal details with PMID, Journal, Title, Year, Chemical ID, Disease ID), disease (Disease ID, Disease Title, Disease Category, Disease Sub-category, TreeNums), and chemical (detailed chemical properties including molecular data, ADMET predictions, and fingerprints).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The MeSH ID of the chemical and disease (format: MESH:CXXXXXX-MESH:DXXXXXX)

get.description: This endpoint returns details about phytochemicals based on chemical properties. Response includes comprehensive chemical information: Chemical ID (MeSH ID), PubChem CID, Canonical SMILES, Isomeric SMILES, Common name, IUPAC name, InChI, Num_Atoms, Molecular_Formula, Molecular_Weight, Molecular_Mass, ALogP (lipophilicity), Molecular_Solubility, pKa, aromatic bonds/rings counts, HBA/HBD counts, ring counts, rotatable bonds, Molecular_SurfaceArea, and full ADMET data (Solubility, BBB penetration, Hepatotoxicity, Absorption, Plasma Protein Binding predictions with applicability domains).

parameters.name: common_name
parameters.description: The common name of the phytochemical

parameters.name: iupac_name
parameters.description: The IUPAC name of the phytochemical

parameters.name: pubchem_id
parameters.description: The PubChem CID of the phytochemical

parameters.name: molecular_weight_from
parameters.description: Lower value of the molecular weight range to query from

parameters.name: molecular_weight_to
parameters.description: Upper value of the molecular weight range to query from

parameters.name: hbd_count
parameters.description: The number of hydrogen bond donors

parameters.name: hba_count
parameters.description: The number of hydrogen bond acceptors

parameters.name: alogp
parameters.description: The lipophilicity of the phytochemical (ability to pass from octanol to water)

parameters.name: smile
parameters.description: The canonical SMILES of the phytochemical - a unique, standardized text representation of a chemical structure

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number
